snippet.textDisplay:
This was our last video for the year 12019 of the Human Era. And what a year it was. So much stuff happened everywhere. To so many different people.
Calendars and holidays are just imaginary but they help us to cut our lives into pieces that our brains can handle.
We are leaving 12019 behind with a weird mixture of disillusion and hope. The world is screwed up. But we can fix it. In a few days this year will be over. And we all get to try again.
Thank you for watching our videos and for sticking around for so many years. See you all in 12020.
snippet.textOriginal:
This was our last video for the year 12019 of the Human Era. And what a year it was. So much stuff happened everywhere. To so many different people.
Calendars and holidays are just imaginary but they help us to cut our lives into pieces that our brains can handle.
We are leaving 12019 behind with a weird mixture of disillusion and hope. The world is screwed up. But we can fix it. In a few days this year will be over. And we all get to try again.
Thank you for watching our videos and for sticking around for so many years. See you all in 12020.

snippet.textDisplay:
Dear Kurzgesagt,
i am almost certain 1:42 is not true.

Yes, everything in the solar system is held in orbit by gravity. But if you accelerate the center of gelravity (sun), all objects in the solar system are accelerated in the suns frame of reference.
So there is a force axial to every object's orbit, which would for sure mess it up, but i am not certain in which way.
snippet.textOriginal:
Dear Kurzgesagt, 
i am almost certain 1:42 is not true. 

Yes, everything in the solar system is held in orbit by gravity. But if you accelerate the center of gelravity (sun), all objects in the solar system are accelerated in the suns frame of reference. 
So there is a force axial to every object's orbit, which would for sure mess it up, but i am not certain in which way.

snippet.textDisplay: So, this aluminum reflector isn't going to get ionized by the star and make magnetic connectivity with CME (Coronal Mass Ejection) and be thrown away, charged, depleted of its elements, and ultimately melt?   Have an engine to roll energy into current focusing it to repel the star from its position by controlling solar weather?  I smell a load of horse shit.

snippet.textDisplay: All of the heat behind such a mirror would fry everything behind it and since the planets rotate around the sun there would be an angle of 360° to avoid and there is the 3 dimensional axis to consider in order to aim it somewhere safe which would limit what it can do. Building a ring around it would require insane material composites in order to withstand the heat and all the radiations which tend to fry electronics along with the other kind of radiations. One of the things which could bypass the heat would be some kind of force field or should i say Magnetic field ? At this point you just need something to create an attraction in order for the Sun to move toward or away from it and control it from a safe distance. Another problem would be how to turn because going foward and backward might end up beinh a big problem. The mirror would be a very bad idea for changing directions and for the Ring even if it can rotate while keeping the sun at it's center, there is still the problem with the materials and how they can withstand it. It's something which could be prevented with the use of some kind of forecefield/magnetic field, but how will it affect the planets rotating around the sun ? Thats another thing to consider. At this point the mirror is not the solution to create an engine, but a solution to create a massive and deadly clean energy Solar Super Weapon.
